message.content:
cs.MA, cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.LG 

This paper proposes a distributed algorithm for multi-resource allocation with no direct inter-agent communication, which falls under the category of multi-agent systems (cs.MA). The algorithm involves probabilistic responses from agents, which suggests a game-theoretic approach (cs.GT). The use of a control unit to broadcast signals to agents implies a distributed computing aspect (cs.DC). The convergence of average allocations to optimal allocations suggests a control systems perspective (cs.SY). Finally, the empirical results and use of probabilistic responses may involve machine learning techniques (cs.LG).
